headline: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald to step down amid languishing sales in the US
summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc, said Thursday that its CEO Calvin McDonald is stepping down effective Jan. 31 as the athletic wear maker wrestles with a year of disappointing sales.  The company, based in Vancouver, Canada, said that McDonald and the board are working together to manage a “smooth transition,” and he will serve as a senior advisor to the company through March 31, 2026.  The board said it was conducting a comprehensive search in partnership with a leading executive search firm to select his successor.

The board said it was conducting a comprehensive search in partnership with a leading executive search firm to select his successor.

headline: Lululemon Chief Executive Calvin McDonald to Depart Next Month
summary: McDonald’s exit comes as the company’s estranged founder had privately been taking steps to mount a proxy fight.

headline: Lululemon jumps 9% as athleisure wear group annonces CEO departure
summary: Investing.com -- Lululemon athletica shares rose 9% in premarket U.S. trading on Friday after the athleisure group’s announced both the departure of CEO Calvin McDonald and a heightened full-year profit forecast.

headline: 'This Is Not Russia, You Can Quit' - Dave Ramsey Says Your Wages Are Stagnant Because You Keep Yourself 'Stuck' In the Same Job
summary: Dave Ramsey says anyone can build wealth by spending less than they earn and taking action to raise their income. Discussing the key steps to getting rich on "The Ramsey Show," he said income is the most powerful tool for getting out of debt and building wealth. Ramsey said people should not remain stuck in low wages and instead work to raise their pay by moving to a new employer. "You know where wages are stagnant? On people who are stagnant," he said. headline: Jim Cramer Says” Buy, Buy, Buy” This Recession-Resistant Dividend Aristocrat Stock
summary: Jim Cramer has built his reputation around energized analysis of growth stocks and whatever is trending at the moment, mostly because that’s what his audience wants to know about the most. However, there are some rare cases where he discusses stocks that are more on the “boring” end, like McDonald’s (NYSE:MCD). Cramer has not implied ...
